Class District

    • metrocs.redistricting.District
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    public class District
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    A district is a contiguous group of locations.
    Version:
    20191006.1
    Author:
    Dr. Jody Paul
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      District()
      Creates a district with no locations.
      District​(java.util.Collection<Location> theLocations)
      Creates a district comprised of the locations specified by the parameter.

    • Method Detail

      • size

        public int size()
        Accesses the number of locations in this district.
        Returns:
        the number of locations

      • locations

        public java.util.Collection<Location> locations()
        Accesses the locations that comprise this district.
        Returns:
        a collection of locations

      • contiguityValid

        public boolean contiguityValid()
        Verifies that all locations in this district are contiguous. Contiguity is always true for districts of size 0 or 1.
        Returns:
        true if all locations are contiguous; false otherwise
